config:get.description:
get config var values for given names
Gets the Salesforce CLI configuration values for your default scratch org, your default Dev Hub org, your default instance URL, or any combination of the three. To see your default scratch org username, include 'defaultusername'.
To see your default Dev Hub, include 'defaultdevhubusername'.
To see your default instance URL, include 'instanceUrl'.
To see the locations where your values are set, include the --verbose flag.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: emit additional command output to stdout
emit additional command output to stdout
verbose.longDescription: Emit additional command output to stdout.

config:list.description: lists the config variables that the Salesforce CLI uses for various commands and tasks.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

config:set.description:
sets the configuration variables that the Salesforce CLI uses for various commands and tasks.
 Local variables apply only to your current project. Global variables apply in any directory.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

global.name: global
global.description: set config var globally (to be used from any directory)
set config var globally (to be used from any directory)
global.longDescription: Sets the configuration variables globally, so they can be used from any directory.

config:unset.description:
unsets the local and global configuration variables for the Salesforce CLI.
 Local variables apply only to your current project. Global variables apply in any directory.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

global.name: global
global.description: unset config var globally (to be used from any directory)
unset config var globally (to be used from any directory)
global.longDescription: Unsets the configuration variables globally, so they can be used from any directory.
